turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Thiazolidinedione.
turn.1: What are the other uses of Thiazolidinedione?
turn.2: Experimental investigations on TZDs have been carried out since 2005 in polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), psoriasis, autism, ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (by VEGF inhibition in granulosa cells), lichen planopilaris, and other conditions.
turn.3: Can you tell me more about the other uses?
turn.4: Several forms of lipodystrophy cause insulin resistance, which has responded favorably to thiazolidinediones.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: There are some indications that thiazolidinediones provide some degree of protection against the initial stages of breast carcinoma development.
turn.7: Is there any other interesting information I should know?
turn.8: Evidence was emerging in 2008 that vitamin E with thiazolidinediones is effective in the treatment of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis due to their combined antioxidant and insulin sensitizing effects, producing histological improvements in steatosis severity.
turn.10: The withdrawal of troglitazone has led to concerns of the other thiazolidinediones also increasing the incidence of hepatitis and potential liver failure, an approximately 1 in 20,000 individual occurrence with troglitazone.
turn.11: Is there any other information you can share about the withdrawal?
turn.12: Because of this, the FDA recommends two to three month checks of liver enzymes for the first year of thiazolidinedione therapy to check for this rare but potentially catastrophic complication.
